Pre-Game Insights: Since the start of 2023, South Africa have lost nine of the 11 completed T20Is they have played.
Sri Lanka, who won the T20 World Cup ten years ago, have never really made the semi-final of a limited-overs global trophy since then.
Heinrich Klaasen clobbered 479 runs at a strike rate of 171 at the IPL, and Matheesha Pathirana took 13 wickets at an economy rate of 7.68 in the same competition.
Sri Lanka have three quicks capable of breaching 145kph, plus Nuwan Thushara, whose most recent T20I outing brought him figures of 5 for 20.
Sri Lanka have spinners Maheesh Theekshana and captain Wanindu Hasaranga, who had recently rekindled his love for the Test format, only to be suspended for those games.
South Africa's top order has blasted their way through last year's ODI World Cup, with Quinton de Kock, Aiden Markram, and Klaasen feeling confident against Sri Lanka's bowlers.
Kagiso Rabada, the only Black African player in the South Africa squad, is coming off a middling IPL and needs to rediscover his bowling magic.
Pathirana had a hamstring complaint but should be available for the match.
Rabada left the IPL early with a soft tissue infection in a lower limb but is available for the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Weather looks great, with highs of mid-20sÂ°C and no predictions for any rain interference.
The ball seamed around and stopped for the spinners on the drop-in pitch.
The ball tended to plug on a slowish outfield, and it didn't look like turf that fielders would be keen to dive on.
